etymology.description: 洛(洛) (luò, "a river or water") and 阳(陽) (yáng, "sun; positive principle"). 洛阳(洛陽) (luòyáng) is the name of a historical city in China, where it refers to a place located by the Luo River with a sunny or favorable position—often south of a river due to the association of 阳(陽) (yáng, "sun") with the south side of a hill or north of a river.
etymology.interpretation: 洛阳(洛陽) (luòyáng) is a historically significant city, once the capital of several Chinese dynasties. Its name reflects its geographic and auspicious positioning by the Luo River, emphasizing prosperity and centrality.

examples.chinese: 洛阳是历史名城(洛陽是歷史名城)。
春天来临时(春天來臨時)，洛阳迎来繁花似锦(洛陽迎來繁花似錦)。
examples.pinyin: Chūntiān láilín shí, Luòyáng yínglái fánhuā sì jǐn.
examples.english: When spring arrives, Luoyang welcomes a profusion of flowers.
